com.xhive.security
Interface XhiveSecurityConfigIf

public interface XhiveSecurityConfigIf

An interface to manipulate the security configuration of the X-Hive/DB server. Note that the superuser is always authenticated with its X-Hive/DB password, never with external authentication.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

See Also:
XhiveDriverIf.getSecurityConfig()

Method Summary
 void disableJavaAuthentication()
          Disable the authentication using the Java Authentication and Authorization Service, reverting to the default X-Hive/DB authentication.
 void enableJavaAuthentication(java.lang.String configurationEntry, XhiveNameHandlerIf nameHandler)
          Enable user authentication using the Java Authentication and Authorization Service.
 boolean usesJavaAuthentication()
          Get the current authentication status.
 

Method Detail

enableJavaAuthentication

void enableJavaAuthentication(java.lang.String configurationEntry,
                              XhiveNameHandlerIf nameHandler)
Enable user authentication using the Java Authentication and Authorization Service. This method can only be called at the X-Hive/DB server.

Parameters:
configurationEntry - The name of the javax.security.auth.login.LoginContext to construct.
nameHandler - An implementation of XhiveNameHandlerIf.

disableJavaAuthentication

void disableJavaAuthentication()
Disable the authentication using the Java Authentication and Authorization Service, reverting to the default X-Hive/DB authentication. This method can only be called at the X-Hive/DB server.

usesJavaAuthentication

boolean usesJavaAuthentication()
Get the current authentication status.

Returns:
Whether the Java Authentication and Authorization Service is enabled.
